Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Ok their food and prices are GREAT. Their fish is very fresh. I love their natto hand rolls but they really need to work on their speed.  Even for simple orders, they are quite slow and that is a big problem with this place.  If they get the slightest bit busy, you can easily wait 10 min for 1 item.  I have no problem going back here, but only during slow times or late at night when it's not busy.

Reviews.Author: Sarit
Reviews.Content: Was the first time at this place we very in joy of there sushi  There price was very good  There service is very good  I will recommend this place to anyone..............

Reviews.Author: Angela
Reviews.Content: Very mediocre sushi, we ended up ordering mostly cooked items because the nigiri was just not good. I wouldn't go back.

Reviews.Author: Mandee
Reviews.Content: This place is the best for AYCE. The only place I will spend this kinda of money! (Well, my boyfriend's money)  LOL. I eat here atleast once a month, sometimes more! Everything is always AMAZINNGGGGGG. You must try tuna carpaccio! MY FAV rolls are Kimmy, SSS, and all of the soft shell crab ones mmmm. Also the white tuna and unagi. Yum.  I think I need to go tomorrow...  And I love the staff, super friendly!! 5 stars all the way ^_^

Reviews.Author: Ghia
Reviews.Content: I guess I didn't get the memo, but once I realized Sushi Koma was a play on Sushi  Coma , I was completely enamored at the genius of the name. Sometimes when I eat here, I still can't believe how dumb I was not to realize it.   In any case, Sushi Koma is a solid AYCE sushi option on the Westside. Parking is plentiful, but seating is not. You are a bit cramped and close to other tables. We had a table for 8 here and had to maneuver a lot to get in and out of our seats, so for larger parties I'd recommend Oyshi instead. One thing I do appreciate about Sushi Koma over other AYCE places is they have yet to mess up my order and food does come out fairly quickly. I'm never worried if they forgot to put an order in. I just tried their hand rolls for the first time last week, and I'm definitely a fan. Their sushi I would say is a bit lesser in quality and freshness than Sushi House Goyemon, but still solid. I think they inflate the prices for non-AYCE so it's always better to just go ahead and get AYCE. I wish they had a few more interesting dessert options than ice cream and mochi, but at the end, I'm always too stuffed to eat a big dessert anyway. My husband is a fan of the Big B roll - baked sushi roll topped with beef, while my favorite baked roll is the Volcano roll.

Reviews.Author: Katherine
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice, once when it was Sushi Freak and another time recently.  They've improved from the last time I've been here.  I remember not liking their specialty appetizers because they just didn't work for me.  But now they taste pretty good.  The tuna carpaccio is drowning in sauces and fried garlic that I don't taste any fish, but the sauce and garlic go very well together.  For their sashimi roll, I remember I didn't like it because it was pretty much piece of fish stuck inside a thick piece of radish. Now they slice the radish very thin so that it doesnt overpower the fish in their roll.  The changes they've made to their appetizers turned me into a fan of Sushi Koma.    Some rolls were a hit or miss.  My friends and I really liked the Kimmi and Big B roll.  We didn't enjoy the Fish Paradise or Pania roll. The nigiri was delicious!  The salmon had a  fluffy, melts in your mouth  consistency, as my friend puts it, and we couldn't stop ordering more.  And the rice:fish ratio was perfect!  The servers are really friendly and since the restaurant is really small (I think there were about 6 tables and the bar) it feels very intimate and it's not too loud.    *they have exotic flavored mochi like coffee and green tea!

Reviews.Author: Minnie
Reviews.Content: A dimly lit sushi joint for the late nights with your friends that like to stuff their faces with oddly named rolls. Let me make it clear right now that, 98% of the time, I will never suggest going out to eat for sushi, but this was a special occasion and my friends chose to have AYCE sushi here on a Friday night.  The Arrival: The wait wasn't too long at all for my party of eight. Yes, eight! I'm guessing we got very lucky!  Sweet!  I thought.  Seated so soon? Love this place already.  NOTE: I would also like to note that it says they take reservations here on Yelp, but I don't think they do.  The Folks Running This Place: Everyone was very friendly, but not all of them were knowledgeable of what the menu items were. Some looks were exchanged on the names of certain orders, but that was solved almost immediately. I wouldn't remember all of them either, if I worked there. This would be a good place to add that their menu selection is extensive! So many weird names to remember! I also asked one of the servers for a recommendation, my table loved it and we ended up ordering another.  The Overall Atmosphere: It'll seem crowded because of the size of the room. People are talking, music is playing, orders are flying out consistently, and the whole place is alive. It's all good.  The Grub: I'm not a sushi lover, but I enjoyed several of the options here, and am the kind of person who is always willing to try everything. My sushi-loving friends enjoyed their food wholeheartedly ordering one after another. Our empty plates would pile high at the end of the table.  ***Here are some menu items we would recommend: seafood tostada, lemon eight roll, ninja roll, mussels, Vegas roll, salmon nigiri and the tuna carpaccio you've probably read about on here about a hundred times is definitely worth a try.  Anyway, they've got my stars. Nothing went wrong, we were treated well, and nearly everything I tried was delicious. And yes, I left full and  koma tose!

Reviews.Author: Jefferson
Reviews.Content: Was recommended this place by a local business. But boy, did it not meet my expectations! First and last time I'll ever dine here. Service was terribly slow and unresponsive. I ordered miso soup 3 times until I finally got it. We were probably waiting 20-30 min in between each order which half of them were actually delivered. The fish was not fresh, tasted like it came straight from the freezer and was thawed out. Their selection was boring and simple. The only good thing about this place was the fish to rice ratio.   Definitely would drive the extra miles and go down spring mountain for better ayce sushi.

Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: Just discovered this amazing sushi place in Vegas. All you can eat sushi dinner for $25.95. Our server Aileen was super friendly and the atmosphere was fun and we had a blast. Check it out!

Reviews.Author: Jade
Reviews.Content: That krazy Gaga was playing overhead:  Can't eat my can't eat my No I can't eat my sushi rolls (She got no more room in tummy) K-k-k-koma face k-k-koma face  This krazy gurl?  Full as a tick.  Entirely my fault I went into Sushi Koma at this cafe in the Desert Breeze Plaza? strip mall.  Barely any signage this eatery is there, but it is.  Right-hand side of the lot.  From the outside, it appears just a teeny non-descript hole in the wall.  Inside feels markedly different.  Nicer, inviting, contemporary.  All You Can Eat brought out the voracious freak in me.  My eyes were WAY bigger than my stomach.  Under 30 bucks is a sweet price for AYCE quality sushi.  Sake, Ama Ebi, Maguro and Hamachi nigiri were the best orders of the meal.  Uni was also pretty good.  Well this *is* the desert, so you cannot expect something like that to remain spankin' fresh, all the way from whatever port it travels.  And I was told it is driven in from L.A.  Tekka Maki, Sashimi roll, Tuna carpaccio were fine.  For the money, should have just continued with nigiri.  Over-did it though with the Elephant, Ponzio and Spider rolls. *bleurggh*  Service was biased :-\ not that warm and welcoming.. at least not to moi.  Let's just say, you'll get improved attentive-ness from waitresses, if you are a male lookin' eligible and seem to be makin' da paper.  Strategy for getting my Sushi Freak on, if there is a next time?  Starve most of the day, then nigiri all the way into another Sushi Koma.

Reviews.Author: Ann
Reviews.Content: It's in a strip mall - you can hardly see it off the street- came in for lunch-- YES, I would come back!!!! Ordered the Brie and Grape Quesadilla- around 8 bucks it was SO different-  DELICATE  is the first word that came to my mind-- note to the Chef-- of the 8 or so pieces only about 3 had actual brie that i could taste- but im giving you 5 stars for now anyway- i like this place- COOL is the vibe of the staff-  i will return!

Reviews.Author: Sarah
Reviews.Content: Affordable all you can eat sushi, SO delicious, and a super friendly staff. We've been here about 5 times so far, and will continue to go back.

Reviews.Author: LJ
Reviews.Content: Don't let the sign outside fool you.  This is Sushi Freak not Brian's Beach Sushi, they just haven't changed the sign outside yet.  Make sure you check-in to the right establishment.  I actually wasn't that hungry but it's been a while since I've ate made to order AYCE sushi so why not it was only $26 for dinner. My order was only a small portion of the menu but easily would have cost me more than $26. I had some shrimp tempura, deep fried oysters, octopus nigiri, elephant roll, red bean ice screen, plus whatever else we shared and some specialty items the sushi chef made for us.  Overall the food was very good but because I didn't try more of the menu it's a 4 which is still very good in my book.  Next time I'm coming hungry.  Service was excellent, the main reason for the 5 rating.  We came with a party of 7 and Sushi Freak accommodated us very well. There was no wait. They were on the spot with bringing all of our orders out quickly and correct, separating bills and taking our money.  They made specialty items just because and said we didn't have to finish them if we didn't like it.  Don't remember how long we were there but they didn't rush us.  They also treated us like their number ones from when we first arrived till we left, excellent first impression.  Definitely will be back.   The dining area is smaller but it doesn't feel crammed.

Reviews.Author: Leslie
Reviews.Content: Sushi was delicious!  The services was amazing.  The place was very efficient and cozy.   LC

Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: Thought I would try a new sushi restaurant with my husband. The ambiance is awesome, the friendliness of staff is amazing, and they offered to customize my sushi just the way I like it at no extra charge. Highly recommend and will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Author: Luc
Reviews.Content: Went there with some friends for lunch when they opened. There was nobody except us (group of 5). The menu was unexciting, full of rolls and baked stuff, which we didn't order. We were all nigiri or raw fish fans. We all opted for the AYCE lunch and ordered some nigiris to start with, and the waitress apologized as there was only one chef and the other was late. We were very understanding, but as we waited and waited for our food, we couldn't understand why it was taking so long. We were the only people in there and they just opened, and we only ordered nigiri, which is just raw fish and rice! It took 20 minutes to get our orders, and most of our 1 1/2 lunch was spent sitting around waiting for food. It would be okay if the food was good, but the fish wasn't fresh or exciting. The fish tasted bland and tasteless. Salmon was off color. Tasted more like something from a very mediocre sushi restaurant, which I think this was. I will never go back again. I am a huge sushi aficionado and have been to very many sushi restaurants, and this was one of the worst I've been to.

Reviews.Author: Michelle
Reviews.Content: Do not order the Kids meal.  It consists of 2 very tiny plate of, in our case, 2x skinny shrimp tempura, 3 Cut in Half pieces, pieces! Not 3 Pieces of sushi, 3 pieces of cut up egg and 1 scoop of ice cream, and was charged $10. Horrible! They also informed us of various fish they were out of AFTER we had started ordering.  WE would not have stayed if we were given this info as we were seated. Been to this place once a year ago and we think the place has go down a lot in quality and service, but considering its AYCE then i guess they are just AYCE quality

Reviews.Author: Allen
Reviews.Content: This is small place on the corner of Durango & Flamingo. It has a small dining area and a small sushi bar, so it fills up quick.  The service here is a little slow and the sushi chefs were not very friendly. The food is great though, so I would recommend trying it out.

Reviews.Author: Jessica
Reviews.Content: Came here solely because I read a review from one of my previous customers. (Hi, Heather H! =o] )  The day my bf and I stopped in, the AC was in repairs. The owner/manager (not sure) made it a point to come by and ask us how we were doing, and informed us that they were getting their AC fixed as soon as possible. He was also offering more than the one dessert per person because of the heat. I liked that he was concerned about the well-being and comfort of his patrons.   Anyway, I have to say that this place delivers. Their hamachi was pretty fresh, and their appetizers and selection had a lot of variety. I liked the tuna carpaccio, and a few other things that I can't remember the names of. (oops!)   This place gets a 4 from me.

Reviews.Author: Brenda
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite ayce! Service and quality compare to none.  I eat a lot of sushi- and this place consistently is awesome. I'd give 10 stars if I could!where to start to order- any of the nigiri is awesome. My husband likes the Fish Paradise and Ponzu Roll with the shrimp tempura. Everyone is friendly and for 25.95 for all you can eat you can't afford to pass this up!

Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: I used to come here a few years ago when it was Brian's Beach. When I heard it closed down, I was sad and found myself lost and confused... Then we saw that this joint opened and took over. I was very skeptical at first to try this place, but I am glad I did! :) if you liked Brian's beach, I believe they kept the same menu.  My bf and I are now frequent visitors of this place. They have stamp cards, which entices us to come back because once you get 10 stamps, you will win a grand prize of eating one free ayce meal! We tried pretty much everything on the menu and haven't been disapointed. Also, if you don't want to order a whole roll and want to attempt to try everything on the menu, ask them to do half rolls. Half rolls are 4 pieces, so you don't fill up so quickly on just one roll of 8 pieces,  The service is impeccable and the waitresses are incredibly friendly. They are always on it, from refilling your drinks, to making sure you get everything you order. The place is small, so if it gets crowded, be expected to wait.  I feel as if the service is great, the food taste that much better. Haha.

Reviews.Author: Sandy
Reviews.Content: I came with a friend a few nights ago and was relieved that there was ample seating still available on a Friday night at 7p. We were sat right away and opted for AYCE, ordering round one once we received menus that were forgotten upon our arrival. We started with salmon, yellowtail, and super white tuna and chatted about life and work while waiting for our fish, though it appeared that nobody else was and were receiving theirs punctually.   Thinking service was pushed back due to the filling dining room, we stopped another server and ordered another round of uni, masago, and amaebi, requesting that the shrimp heads be fried, before round one touched down. Nope - these items came out almost as soon as we ordered it, so we stopped not one, but two servers, to inquire about the first couple of items. The servers assured us that it was  on the way,  but everything about the timing and operation just seemed out of whack. I wasn't sure if I was supposed to leave feeling like I was in a  k oma (ugh, by the way, I hate replacing c-words with a  k ), or if the communication between the servers was comatose. Sorry,  k omatose.   I do have to say, though, that the girls working the dining room are very personable, all things said. If any one of them has her own station, we certainly didn't see it - at any time we were able to place orders with anyone, and everyone came by to inquire about us and refill our beverages. A plus!

Reviews.Author: Julie
Reviews.Content: I think this is by far one of the best ayce sushi spots in town. Like seriously, the size of the nigiri and rolls were perfect-no awkward mouth stuffing and everything tastes amazingly good! I feel like the fish is very fresh because when I eat salmon or yellowtail at other places I sometimes get this icky after taste but nope, not at Koma. I usually don't order rolls when I do ayce, but this place really has some awesome rolls, like the fish paradise. The only reason I'm giving them 4 stars is because they don't have oysters or a huge selection of appetizers/desserts, but that's okay bc I'll still be back when I was some bomb sushi. Also this is a pretty small place so be wary of wait times.

Reviews.Author: Lisa
Reviews.Content: Food here is good.  Prices aren't bad either.  However the service was really slow on my last visit.  Came here New years day for lunch AYCE sushi.  We were sat quickly however it took a bit for your server to come over and the food took a while also, he seemed a little overwhelmed.  The dining room is small and all the tables were not filled.  I ordered a bunch of items for AYCE sushi.  My salmon skin handroll, which is my go to...was covered in some weird ponzu sauce that seemed to be on alot of menu items we ordered.  It was a bit over bearing.  Towards the end of the meal it seemed like our food options were forgotten and they took even longer to come out.  I can understand not being ready for the lunch crowd on a holiday and I would definitely go back here in hopes that the service is better.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy
Reviews.Content: SK is dope! Been a part of my training diet for quite awhile now -Always fresh fish, everytime. Chefs are fun and good at what they do, as are the waitresses -They are awesome. I've had alot of Sushi, and this little place is worth making your spot.

Reviews.Author: Richie
Reviews.Content: Food - Their fried oysters were disgusting. They tasted old and frozen for months. It left me with an after taste all night. Sesame chicken was dry and sauce was not good. Uni sushi was crunchy, they forgot to defrost the ice. House salad was covered in dressing, I couldn't taste any greens. I thought, there's no way they will mess up my ice cream, right? My green tea ice cream tastes nothing like green tea, it had a bubble gum flavor. These were the main complaints, I haven't mentioned about other dishes. Yucky food!  Service: They were friendly, but were very disorganized. They took my orders, but forgot to bring food out; I waited for one of my dishes for 30 min, when I asked them, they told me they didn't have the ingredients today, then why didn't u tell me when I placed my order and had me waited the whole time? Also, I had to beg for refill of my tea. The waiters were just running around like crazy. They had 8 tables and 5 waiters, come on. Another table got up and left.   First time there, and will be my last time. If you want all you can eat sushi.  Doh  sushi in chinatown is the best in town, great food, great service. I made a mistake, should have gone to Doh like I always do!

Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: So fresh and so good. The sashimi roll, tostada app, and white tuna nigiri are my faves. This is my post Red Rock hike meal.

Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: The sushi was very good, but what put this place over the top was the outstanding service.  The waitresses were prompt, professional and pleasant.  I will not hesitate to return to this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Guty
Reviews.Content: came thru word of mouth and it did not dissapoint. great quality seafood and friendly staff. small quaint place, good for couples

Reviews.Author: Christian
Reviews.Content: Place was great. All you can eat sushi, great sake! Staff was prompt friendly and very helpful ordering so much food. I was in a Koma for sure! Great place

Reviews.Author: Madeline
Reviews.Content: Favorite sushi place! Recommend the kimmy and almost fire. All the sashimi is good.   AYCE $25 for dinner and $21 for lunch (before 3:00)  Hannah serves me a lot and she is attentive and adorable.   The inside is cozy and really cute. Open late! Come here!

Reviews.Author: Din
Reviews.Content: Here we are, 3 1/2 years later, and this is still one of the best sushi places around.  It just get's busier, and better!  Finally went with a friend whom is a sushi fanatic, and all about  All you can eat .    He ate to his hearts content, and barely came up for air.  I had to ask him after the meal what he thought? His response was  Great!  Everything tasted wonderful to him, and he said he didn't feel shorted or cheated on quality or execution.  I personally don't do the AYCE, as my appetite won't allow, but to have that come from a sushi foodie is huge.  Just one of the many reasons I've maintained Sushi Koma as an absolute gem of a restaurant.  Of course the service was good (As usual), even with several new faces. Efficient and quick, even though they were super busy that evening.  Go.... That's all I can say.

Reviews.Author: Dre
Reviews.Content: I decided to try to place out considering it was the only sushi spot open late at night. I ordered a Hamachi as its one of my favorite nigiri's. The flavor was bland and I didn't even want to eat it anymore. So I had some left overs which I didn't know what to do with it. There California rolls are alright and so are there masago's. Nothing to special at this spot. For me, this place is way to over priced for the quality of fish that we are given. Not worth the money. After my experience, I don't think I'll eat here again.
